The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 21.17 is: Use of the string handling functions from <string.h> shall not result in accesses beyond the bounds of the objects referenced by their pointer parameters.
This rule strictly applies to the Standard Library functions in <string.h> such as memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, and strspn.

explanation: Rule 21.17 concerns use of functions from <string.h> (e.g. memcpy, memmove, memset, memcmp, strcpy, strncpy, strcat, strncat, strlen, strspn) that can access beyond object bounds. The provided function contains no calls to any of these library functions or any other obvious string/memory-manipulation calls. The only external calls are metal_spinlock_acquire and metal_spinlock_release which operate on a struct metal_spinlock pointer (not a char buffer or standard string function) and thus are outside the scope of this rule. There is no pointer arithmetic, buffer indexing, or use of C string functions in the snippet, and the only pointer-related expression is the returned NULL which does not invoke string handling. Therefore there are no code fragments in this snippet that need investigation for Rule 21.17.
